title: Liberty Lake 2013 Tempranillo (Red Mountain)
description: This wine shows vanilla, celery root, mesquite and herb aromas on the nose. Its baking spice flavors are quite sweet, suggesting heavy-handed oak. Vanilla flavors take over on the finish, leaving a disjointed impression.

title: Lichen Estate 2013 Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine lays on the vanilla, cream and butter flavors along with a seeming sweetness and smooth texture due to soft effervescence and apparently low acidity. It's very flavorful and plays outside the bounds of traditional sparkling wine.

title: Locations NV CA4 Red (California)
description: So ripe and jammy tasting that it seems sweet, this wine is dark in color, rich in aroma and packed full of blueberry, milk chocolate and blackberry flavors. It feels lightly tannic, but the acidity is soft and the flavors are so opulent that it's easy to sip.

title: Maison Champy 2015  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This spicy, wood-laden wine has strong burnt-toast flavors that have suppressed the fruit. Hints of ripe fruits lie behind the spice and vanilla. Drink this from 2018, in case the wood integrates better.

title: Martin Ranch 2013 Thérèse Vineyards Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This is an extremely savory wine, with aromas of black pepper, dried herbs, turned earth and a touch of elderberry jam. It's somewhat thin on the sip, with cedar, boysenberry and charred beef flavors.

title: McGregor 2016 Semi Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Penetrating white grapefruit, lemon and lime collide in this revitalizing citrus crush. It's harmoniously sweet yet balanced by fresh acidity and a feather-light briskness on the palate.

title: Meurgey-Croses 2015 Vieilles  (Viré-Clessé)
description: Smoky and with strong wood flavors, this wine also has an attractive crisper edge that gives it a bright character. A lively wine, it's both rich and crisp. Drink now.

title: Michael Sullberg 2015 Reserve Lot 92 Chardonnay (California)
description: Light lemon and vanilla flavors and a creamy texture make this wine easy to drink. The body is on the light side, too, with soft acidity and a mouthfeel that's not too thick.

title: Fulkerson 2016 Juicy Sweet Estate Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Slightly candied peach and honeydew flavors are indeed juicy and sweet in this spry, sweet-tart Riesling. It's forward and fruity but balanced keenly in acidity. Enjoy now.

title: Gérard Bertrand 2016 Gris Blanc Rosé (Pays d'Oc)
description: A pale pink color, this starts with dainty, delicate aromas of white cherry and strawberry hull. The palate is similarly light in intensity, with a clean, mouthwatering finish that's immensely refreshing. Drink now.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: This bottling shows its 88% stainless steel aging with bountiful tropicality, including guava and tuberose on the nose as well as toasted nuts and honeydew. Crisp lime peels start the sip, and then come more guava touches as well as mango. It's quite fruity.

title: Glenora 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: Jasmine, lychee and tea leaf notes perfume this light-footed, slightly off-dry Gewürztraminer. Fresh citrus and stone fruit flavors are crisp and easy going, finishing on a more herbaceous tone. Drink now through 2018.

title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2015 Aux Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: The wine is juicy with intense acidity. Its red-currant flavor is consistent with this acidity. Tannins are firm and will soften. The juicy aftertaste gives the wine crispness.

title: Fillaboa 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of white flowers and oily melon set up an agile palate with racy citric acidity. Pithy citrus and green-herb flavors are a touch salty. The wine is fresh with an herbal flavor on the finish.

title: Eberle 2016 Côtes-du-Robles Blanc White (Paso Robles)
description: Quite mellow on the nose, this blend of 58% Grenache Blanc, 38% Roussanne and 4% Viognier offers very light marzipan and fresh white-peach aromas. It's a very easy to quaff wine on the sip, with lemon-peel and apricot flavors.

title: Ego Bodegas 2014 Infinitio Red (Jumilla)
description: This combination of Monastrell and Cabernet Sauvignon is so heavily oaked that it smells almost entirely of clove. A grabby palate delivers flavors of blueberry, blackberry and clove in front of a finish that's woody and tannic. Time will tell if the oak will subside; at this moment it's dominant.

title: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni 2016  Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo
description: Orchard fruit, Mediterranean scrub, violet and wild berry aromas take center stage in this fragrant wine. The fresh, enjoyable palate doles out Marasca cherry and juicy raspberry flavors alongside zesty acidity.
winery: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni

title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2016 Clos de la Bressande  (Mâcon-Villages)
description: This fruity wine is full of bright acidity. Crisp and clean, it shows yellow fruits and a shot of citrus. The aftertaste is lively and bright. Drink now.

title: Domaine Touzot 2016  Mâcon-Villages
description: Bright and fruity, this delicious wine is crisp, clean and refreshing. With yellow fruits followed by zesty acidity, it's both open and textured. Drink now.

title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: From vines in the vineyards behind the Côtes de Nuits, this wine is warm, smooth and ripe. It offers yellow fruits as well as rich apple and enough acidity to give a crisp edge. It's attractive and will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Rooster Hill 2016 Estate Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: Juicy, plump and just a shade off dry, this medium-bodied Gewürztraminer offers easy, fruity grapefruit and pear flavors accented by hints of jasmine tea, saffron and fennel. A touch of tea tannins lends structure to the finish.

title: Rooster Hill 2016 Estate Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Subtle lime and tangerine notes on the nose gain ripeness on the palate of this off-dry Riesling. It's a surprisingly plush, juicy wine offering sweet honeydew and peach flavors balanced by crisp acidity. The finish is pleasantly blossomy. Drink now to enjoy its fresh, fruity vitality.

title: Errazuriz 2015 Max Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Aconcagua Costa)
description: Roasted berry and spent coffee aromas blend with leathery notes that suggest animal. This wine feels solid but rough and grabby. Savory plum and berry flavors finish with a note of baking spices.

title: Famille Fabre 2016 Grande Courtade L'Instant Rosé (Pays d'Oc)
description: White peach, cherry and cranberry fruits are coupled with attractive scents of white tea, talc and peony on the nose of this wine. There's a subtle texture to the lightweight palate, thanks to notes of lime pith and bitter melon rind. It's well balanced and easy to like.

title: Pendulum 2015 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This blend of Petit Verdot (28%), Malbec (27%), Syrah (20%), Cabernet Sauvignon (16%) and Merlot (9%) leads with wild blueberry, crushed flower, herb, vanilla and spice aromas. Soft, elegant blueberry flavors follow, persisting on the finish. Light on the midpalate, it still brings appeal.

title: Pico Maccario 2015 Tre Roveri  (Barbera d'Asti)
description: This wine's baking spice, vanilla and black-skinned berry aromas drift out of the glass. The straightforward palate offers mature black cherry, clove and tobacco flavors while rounded tannins lend easygoing support. Drink soon.

title: Pierre-Yves et Olivier Fichet 2016 Château London  (Mâcon)
description: This is a warm, rich wine. Its fruit is muted at this stage although there's potential in the good acidity and smooth, juicy texture. Let it open out more and drink from 2018.

title: Raimat 2015 Castell de Raimat Albariño (Costers del Segre)
description: A yellow color and yeasty aromas announce a mature wine that's still holding onto a flowery essence. A plump body is balanced by citric acidity, while this tastes of tangerine and sea brine. A citric finish is lively, but this wine needs to be drunk soon.

title: Marcel Couturier 2015 Le Clos Reyssie  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This is a tight, textured wine, with plenty of acidity to balance the ripe fruit. It has the generous texture typical of the vintage and ripe yellow fruits, with an attractive crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Marcel Couturier 2015 Les Longues Terres  (Mâcon-Loché)
description: This wine is smooth, mature and rich with yellow fruits and a rounded texture. A hint of wood and spice has plenty of crisp acidity to balance. Drink now.
